# --description-- You only want one radio input to be selectable at a time. However, the form does not know the radio inputs are related. To relate the radio inputs, give them the same `name` attribute with a value of `account-type`. Now, it is not possible to select both radio inputs at the same time. # --hints-- You should give the first radio input the `name` attribute with a value of `account-type`. ```js assert.equal(document.querySelector('fieldset:nth-child(2) label:nth-child(1) input[type="radio"]')?.name, 'account-type'); ``` You should give the second radio input the `name` attribute with a value of `account-type`. ```js assert.equal(document.querySelector('fieldset:nth-child(2) label:nth-child(2) input[type="radio"]')?.name, 'account-type'); ``` You should not give the `checkbox` the `name` attribute. ```js assert.isEmpty(document.querySelector('fieldset:nth-child(2) label:nth-child(3) input[type="checkbox"]')?.name); ``` # --seed-- ## --seed-contents-- ```html Registration Form
